markdown: CRITERIA FOR THE ALLOWANCE OF TRAVEL EXPENSES TO CHAIRMEN, VICE CHAIRMEN AND INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS OF PANELS AS ESTABLISHED FOR THE WHITE HOUSE CONFERENCE ON FOOD, NUTRITION AND HEALTH I. Criteria for Payment of Travel Expenses Because of limited funding of the Conference, it has been necessary to restrict the payment of travel expenses to panel members in the following categories: 1. Poor and disadvantaged 2. Staff members from various university departments that would not be able to acquire funds for this purpose from their departments' budgets. 3. University department heads who would not be able to charge travel expenses of this type to a federal grant or contract, or a grant from a private foundation. (Department heads are encouraged, wherever possible, to pay their own travel expenses from current grants and contracts received from private foundations and federal agencies.) 4. Members and staff of religious organizations and members of the Clergy. 5. Members and employees of Social Service Organizations. 6. Employees of other nonprofit associations and organizations. 7. Private citizens who cannot otherwise be funded by an organization. 8. State and local government employees. 9. Hospital staff II. Exceptions to Payment of Travel Allowances TheThe following categories of individuals would be requested to cover their own travel expenses to panel meetings: 1. Officers and administrative staff of private firms and organizations. 2. University Administrative staff such as Presidents, Vice-Presidents, deans, etc. 3. University department heads and other professionals who have grants or contracts from Federal agencies and private foundations where a certain portion of these funds could be justifiably used for the purpose of attending panel meetings. 4. Officers and members of trade associations and other business associ-ations and organizations. 5. Individual private citizens, professional people and others who have the means to finance their own transportation. 6. Hospital Administrators Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/ysbd0227
